Crimes.Legal_Issue: Sufficiency of credibility concerns based on use of false documents and inconsistencies to dismiss refugee claim
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant not credible due to use of false documents and testimony inconsistencies
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Impact of PTSD, rural background, and fear of authority on inconsistencies
Crimes.Application_Error: Overemphasis on peripheral inconsistencies; failure to consider psychological and cultural context
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Applicant's PTSD and its effect on memory and disclosure
Crimes.Application_Factor: Use of false travel documents and inconsistent statements
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed based on credibility
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule requiring consideration of trauma, culture, and context in credibility assessments
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Board's decision quashed; case remanded for re-determination
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility due to document fraud and inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in travel narrative deemed minor and contextually explainable
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about fairness in credibility assessment process
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Use of false travel documents acknowledged but contextually explained
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies related to travel details, not core persecution claim
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Trauma and cultural factors mitigate credibility concerns
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Case law on credibility and trauma (e.g., Singh c. Canada, Khosa v. Canada)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to conduct meaningful contextual analysis
Crimes.Omission_Type: Minor omissions in travel timeline and agent involvement
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation under s. 40(1)(a) potentially applicable but not conclusively established

Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board dismissed claim based on inconsistencies and omissions

Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Insufficient reasoning on central aspects of claim
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation in entry documents with contextual justification
